question: The basicity of an oxoacid of phosphorus is determined by:
options: \text{Number of P--OH bonds (ionisable H atoms only)}
answer: \text{Number of P--OH bonds (ionisable H atoms only)}
tip: P–H bonds are non-ionisable. Only P–OH bonds contribute to basicity. H₃PO₃ is dibasic (2 P–OH), H₃PO₄ is tribasic (3 P–OH).
